item.title: 2026-01-02 Paper published in National Science Review
item.description: Our paper Evolutionary convergence and divergence of hippocampal cytoarchitecture between rodents and primates revealed by single-cell spatial transcriptomics has been accepted for publication in National Science Review.

item.title: 2025-04-30 Visiting PhD at UNSW sydney
item.description: During my one-year visiting program at UNSW, I systematically expanded my expertise in epigenomics, becoming proficient in ATAC-seq, ChIP-seq, and CUT&RUN data analysis. I applied multiple approaches to investigate the conservation of regulatory elements across species and explored the application of deep learning in biological data analysis. Throughout this experience, I further strengthened my research collaboration skills and broadened my international academic perspective, laying a solid foundation for the study of complex gene regulatory mechanisms.

item.title: 2022-09-08 Paper published in Genes & Diseases
item.description: Our paper Single-cell transcriptome landscape and antigen receptor dynamic during SARS-CoV-2 vaccination has been accepted for publication in Genes & Diseases.

item.title: 2021-12-09 Paper published in Nature Communications
item.description: Our paper Strategies to package recombinant Adeno-Associated Virus expressing the N-terminal gasdermin domain for tumor treatment has been accepted for publication in Nature Communications.
